result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Christopher Weems was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony Christopher Weems is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony Christopher Weems was found guilty of Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Christopher Weems

records.addlTxt: Signed Restitution Order
Confidential Crime Victim Information
JOC sent to jail

11:00 AM Defendant Anthony Christopher Weems in court, in custody.  Attorney Kevin Van Ert in court for Anthony Christopher Weems.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties indicate that an agreement has been reached. State asks for a sentence of 107 days jail, with credit for 107 days. Civil judgment of $300 restitution to be paid. State asks that count 2 be dismissed and count 3 be dismissed but read in for restitution purposes.
Defendant pleads no contest to count 1. Attorney Van Ert stipulates to a factual basis. Court finds that the defendant's pleas have been knowingly and voluntarily made. Court accepts the defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty. Court dismisses count 2 in its entirety. Count 3 is dismissed but read in. 
Court orders 107 days jail, with credit for 107 days. Court costs,  and civil judgment of $300 in restitution to be paid to victim. 120 days to pay. Court notes defendant will be in custody in another jurisdiction and is instructed to work out payment extension if necessary.

11:23 AM Defendant Anthony Christopher Weems in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gramstrup has filed motion to withdraw. Defendant agrees. Court explains that trial may be postponed if he gets a different attorney. Dates to remain on calendar.
Motion to withdraw granted.
Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Amended Notice of Motion to Withdraw
Proposed Order to Withdraw
Affidavit in Support of Motion
Motion to Withdraw as Counsel

11:24 AM Defendant Anthony Christopher Weems in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Anthony Christopher Weems.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gramstrup indicates that the Defendant is requesting a speedy trial. Defendant makes statement to the court about addressing cases in MN. Court indicates that the case here will need to be resolved in WI first.
Jury trial scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:59 AM Defendant Anthony Christopher Weems in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Anthony Christopher Weems.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case. Close to resolution, asks for status.
Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:15 am.

11:41 AM Defendant Anthony Christopher Weems in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Anthony Christopher Weems.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gramstrup received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Gramstrup requests status conference. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
9:11 AM Defendant Anthony Christopher Weems in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Anthony Christopher Weems.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Christopher Weems
Current: 105 West 1st Street, Duluth, MN 55805 United States  (Effective: 05-10-2022)
Prior: 225 N 27Th Ave W, Duluth, MN 55803
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
No use or possession of a dangerous weapon. No contact with Victim #1 or their residence.

4:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Angela M Wilson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony Christopher Weems appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Anthony Christopher Weems. Court received updated address for defendant. Attorney Hoffman waives reading, pleads not guilty to misdemeanors and requests preliminary hearing on Count 2. State requests  $2,000 cash bail with conditions of No use or possession of a dangerous weapon. No contact with Victim #1 or their residence. Defendant continues to have contact with victim regardless of court orders. Defendant has 3 ftas on 2021 case. Defendant has several past charges out of Minnesota with fta's. Defendant has been a local resident of  the area for several years. Defendant could post up to $450-500 bail. Court orders $2,000 cash bail with condition of no use or possession of a dangerous weapon. No contact with Victim #1 or their residence.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
